title: Habitat
description: Frogs are found on every continent except Antarctica. They thrive in a wide variety of habitats, including rainforests, swamps, ponds, lakes, and even deserts. Most frogs need a moist environment to survive.

title: Diversity
description: There are over 7,000 known species of frogs, making them one of the most diverse groups of vertebrates. They come in many shapes, sizes, and colors.

title: Diet
description: Frogs are carnivorous and primarily eat insects, spiders, and other small invertebrates. Larger species may eat small mammals, birds, or even other frogs.

title: Life Cycle
description: Frogs undergo metamorphosis: they start as eggs, hatch into aquatic tadpoles, and then transform into adult frogs with lungs and legs.

title: Adaptations
description: Frogs have specialized adaptations such as webbed feet for swimming, sticky tongues for catching prey, and skin that can absorb water and oxygen.

title: Camouflage
description: Many frog species use camouflage to blend into their surroundings, helping them avoid predators and sneak up on prey.

title: Conservation
description: Frog populations are declining worldwide due to habitat loss, pollution, disease, and climate change. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect these amazing amphibians.

title: Communication
description: Frogs communicate using a variety of calls and sounds, especially during mating season. Each species has its own unique call.
